JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Emergency Department (ED)
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) - Holy Family Hospital - Haverhill, MA

Come join Steward Health Care System where we strive to serve the needs of our communities by delivering the highest quality of care with compassion and respect. Our continued focus on the patient experience informs our caregivers in how to provide care that is respectful of and responsive to individual patient and family preferences, needs and values.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Job Summary:

Emergency Department Registered Nurses specialize in assessing, intervening and stabilizing a variety of trauma and illnesses with decisive action. Due to the range of medical conditions that may require urgent treatment and care, they must be knowledgeable about general as well as specific health issues.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Job Description:
  • The Registered Nurse provides patient care based on standards of care, standards of practice, protocols, and established policies and procedures.
  • Collaboratively plans and prepares patient/family for discharge incorporating support systems/resources necessary.
  • Appropriately prioritizes patient care (e.g. seeks assistance as needed from appropriate resources, reassigns personnel as necessary, recognizes need for emergency intervention, etc.)
  • Provides thorough, timely and accurate documentation of all pertinent data, therapeutic interventions and patient responses including assessment, care plan, patient goals and interventions according to established standards.
  • Proactively identifies risk to patient safety and identifies opportunities to reduce medical/health care errors (i.e. appropriate reporting of errors/incidents).
  • Safely administers medications and intravenous therapy in accordance with physician's orders, protocols, policies and procedures.
  • Assesses patient pain level upon admission and as necessary, utilizing the pain scale (e.g. numerical, FACES and functional goals.)
  • Reassesses effectiveness of pain control and notifies physicians as needed, as well as, documents assessment and patients' response to medication.
  • Readily accepts accountability for designated patient and effectively hands off patient as required.
  • Appropriately delegates and supervises nursing interventions performed by others.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Qualifications:
  • Graduate of accredited school of nursing.
  • Current nursing licensure in Massachusetts required.
  • BSN preferred.
  • BCLS required.
  • ACLS required within 6 months of hire.
  • TNCC and ENPC required within 1 year of hire.
  • Critical thinking skills and ability to perform medication dosing calculations.
  • Demonstrated clinical competence in the specialty area of nursing practice preferred.
 
Interested Candidates Please Contact:

Joe Della Vecchia

  • Documents initial and ongoing patient assessment in a complete, concise, and timely manner according to policy and procedure of MHMC.
  • Develops and modifies and effective, comprehensive, and individualized plan of care including discharge planning for assigned patients, utilizing standards of care developed by MHMC.
  • Applies knowledge and skills necessary to provide care appropriate to the age of the patient served, i.e.: infant pediatric, adolescent, adult, and geriatric.
  • Initiates and coordinates patient teaching according to identified needs.
  • Integrates, delegates, and coordinates patient care using interdisciplinary approach.
  • Delegates responsibilities for care, when applicable, and makes assignments according to skills of caregiver.
  • Evaluates patient responses to interventions according to established policy and procedure of MHMC.
  • Demonstrates an ability to plan and supervise other patient caregivers in providing patient care on unit while functioning as a professional role model.
  • Demonstrates the ability to exercise independent judgment in times of need and emergency situations and evaluates the results of actions taken.
  • Administers medication and perform treatments, utilizing principles of aseptic technique to assigned patient according to the established policy and procedure of MHMC.

JOB.JobTitle: Risk Manager
JOB.JobDescription:
A local hospital is seeking a dedicated Risk Manager for immediate hire.

 Responsibilities: 

1. Assists the Director of Quality and Safety and the Manager of Regulatory Readiness with the implementation of a system-wide Quality and Safety Plan through board-approved plans with regulatory and standard setting agencies.
2. Collaborate with any and all staff, in addition to acting as a Consultant to the Q & S Task Forces, Directors of Support Services, and Medical Staff Service Committee. May also be responsible for serving as a Chair of Risk for affiliated boards.  
3. Manage a Risk Identification Process for the organization’s operations, departments, and services. Educates and assists other managers in assessing their areas of responsibility for exposures to loss and unsafe processes and conditions.
4. Maintain the risk management information system. Collect, evaluate, and report on events, incidents, and claims. Perform statistical analysis and trending of events and claims to pinpoint high-risk areas for management attention. Review and analyze incident reports, rates by severity, and conducts all follow-up as identified from review. Completes trending analysis to identify top priority areas for improvement.
5. Coordinate internal surveys and inspections, monitors reports, and coordinates corrective actions or recommended improvements with management and staff.
6. Remain knowledgeable about and promotes compliance with professional standards and guidelines. Implements changes to ensure consistency with regulatory requirements.
7. Work with general counsel to coordinate the investigation, processing, settlement, and defense of claims and suits against the organization. Notifies insurance carriers of potential and actual claims. Coordinates the release of information in response to subpoenas, court orders, attorney requests, etc.
8. Reviews all patient complaints and work with patient advocate to offer solutions to patient grievances. Also works with Billing and Compliance Officers in deciding on appropriateness of billing waivers/write-offs.

Requirements: 

1. Bachelor’s Degree, MS or JD preferred. Certified Professional in Healthcare Risk Management (CPHRM) a plus.
2. Management or Quality Improvement experience, with two to five years’ experience in a healthcare setting focused on Patient Safety.
3. Experience and understanding of the Root Cause Analysis and FMEA Analysis.

JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Behavioral Health Unit
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) Behavioral Health Unit - CentraState Medical Center - Freehold, NJ

CentraState Medical Center is seeking a Registered Nurse (RN) for the Behavioral Health Unit.

Full-Time, Nights

Registered Nurse (RN) Behavioral Health Unit Position Summary:

The Behavioral Health Registered Nurse administers culturally sensitive nursing care to assigned patients that is in accordance with ANA standards, the NJ Practice Act, Joint Commission, professional standards and established hospital and Nursing Department policy and procedures in accordance with evidence based nursing practice. Registered Nurses utilize the Nursing Process in providing patient centered care. Evaluates the effectiveness of nursing care through the analysis of nurse sensitive indicators and patient outcomes. Orientation will include satisfactory completion of the Critical Care, IV Therapy and Respiratory Courses, as well as, successful rotation through assigned Nursing Units. A patient focused care model utilizing a multidisciplinary approach is used as the method to deliver patient care. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Provides considerate respectful care focused upon the patient's individual needs to ensure patient satisfaction.
  • Affirms the patient's right to make decisions regarding his/her medical care, including the decision to discontinue treatment, to the extent permitted by law.
  • Obtains a complete nursing history and baseline assessment that is systematic, consistent and continuous. This assessment is communicated effectively utilizing Hand-off policy and documented.
  • Documents results of patient assessment, nursing diagnosis, care plan nursing interventions and evaluation and patient progress in medical record according to hospital/nursing policy and the Nursing Standards of Care/Practice for the specific patient type.
  • Appropriately analyzes patient information /assessment to determine nursing diagnosis and needs for appropriate nursing care, medical intervention or services of other clinical professionals.

JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) - Operating Room - CentraState Medical Center - Freehold, NJ

Registered Nurse (RN) - Operating Room Position Summary:

The Operating Room Registered Nurse administers culturally sensitive nursing care to assigned patients that is in accordance with ANA standards, the NJ Practice Act, Joint Commission, professional standards and established hospital and Nursing Department policy and procedures in accordance with evidence based nursing practice. Utilizes the Nursing Process in providing patient centered care. The RN evaluates the effectiveness of nursing care through the analysis of nurse sensitive indicators and patient outcomes. Orientation will include satisfactory completion of CPR Certification, IV Course, and Departmental Orientation. A patient focused care model utilizing a multidisciplinary approach is used as the method to deliver patient care. Tasks include but are not limited to:
  • Evaluate patients' vital signs or laboratory data to determine emergency intervention needs.
  • Monitor patients for changes in status and indications of conditions such as sepsis or shock and institute appropriate interventions.
  • Assess patients' pain levels.
  • Administer medications.
  • Conduct pulmonary assessments to identify abnormal respiratory patterns or breathing sounds that indicate problems.
  • Prioritize nursing care for assigned critically ill patients, based on assessment data or identified needs.
  • Consult and coordinate with healthcare team members to assess, plan, implement, or evaluate patient care plans.
  • Perform emergency medical procedures, such as basic cardiac life support (BLS), advanced cardiac life support (ACLS), and other condition stabilizing interventions.
Registered Nurse (RN) - Operating Room Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing required.
  • Graduate of an approved program for Registered Nurses.
  • Current license to practice in New Jersey.
  • Previous operating room experience preferred.
  • American Heart Association Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) is required.
  • ACLS and CNOR certified preferred.
CentraState Medical Center, located at 901 West Main Street in Freehold, New Jersey, is an acute-care medical center licensed for 284 beds.  The medical center is a teaching hospital in conjunction with the Rutgers Robert Wood Johnson Medical School Family Medicine Residency Program.  Also in 2015, the hospital was re-designated with Magnet status for nursing excellence by the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC) of the American Nurses Association.

JOB.JobTitle: Palliative Medicine   Miami, Florida
JOB.JobDescription:
Palliative Medicine  
Miami, Florida

Miami Cancer Institute, a rapidly growing and evolving community based “academic” cancer center (part of Baptist Health South Florida, the leading hospital system in south Florida) is seeking a Palliative Medicine physician to join two colleagues in its highly respected Symptom Management and Palliative Medicine Division.. The state-of-the-art 395,000 square foot Cancer Institute serves south Florida, the Southeastern region of the United States, Latin America and the Caribbean. We welcome both experienced and newly-trained Palliative Medicine physicians to consider this outstanding opportunity. 

Practice:
  • Baptist Health South Florida (now an 11 hospital system) one of the most financially secure health systems in the United States, opened the Miami Cancer Institute in January 2017.
  • The physician medical staff at the Cancer Institute already includes over 80 physicians and surgeons, and there is  a dynamic strategic growth plan in place.
  • You will join two other Palliative Medicine physicians in this vital, established and highly thought of Division..
  • Outpatient practice in a unique and patient/family-oriented suite, built specifically for the Symptom Management and Palliative Medicine Division. 
  • The Institute is a full service cancer facility, encompassing sophisticated medical oncology care (including stem cell transplantation and Car-T Cell therapy), surgical oncology (including sub-specialty surgeons in all diseases), radiation oncology (including arguably the best-equipped radiation oncology division in the nation) and a full clinical research division. 
  • The Miami Cancer Institute enjoys a deep and functional alliance with Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, with an emphasis on  standards of care and clinical trials.
  • The compensation package is extremely competitive, is non-wRVU based and includes a quality bonus incentive.   In addition, a comprehensive benefits and relocation package is offered.
Location:
  • Miami Cancer Institute’s physical location in Miami-Dade County, just south of the city of Coral Gables, is within 10 to 20 minutes of several ideal communities, with excellent public and private schools, in which you and your family can find a wide array of housing opportunities. 
  • In addition to Miami’s wonderful year-round weather, one would have easy access to the cities of Miami and Miami Beach, which have become international destinations. They offer an array of recreational opportunities, shopping, the arts and professional and collegiate sports.
  • Miami’s airport, 20 minutes from the Institute, offers a vast option of domestic and international flights.
As a Palliative Medicine physician, you have a number of opportunities to consider. However, few will offer you the personal and professional satisfaction, the opportunity to work in a truly state-of-the-art facility with highly regarded colleagues and excellent financial rewards offered by this position. Flexible schedules available!

Registered Nurse (RN) - Surgical Services/Operating Room (OR) Position Summary:

The Operating Room/Surgical Services Registered Nurse will assess patient health problems and needs, develop and implement nursing care plans, and maintain medical records. Administer nursing care to ill, injured, convalescent, or disabled patients. Operating Room (OR) Registered Nurses (RN) provide advanced nursing care for patients with acute conditions such as heart attacks, respiratory distress syndrome, or shock. Tasks include but are not limited to:
  • Evaluate patients' vital signs or laboratory data to determine emergency intervention needs.
  • Monitor patients for changes in status and indications of conditions such as sepsis or shock and institute appropriate interventions.
  • Assess patients' pain levels.
  • Administer medications.
  • Conduct pulmonary assessments to identify abnormal respiratory patterns or breathing sounds that indicate problems.
  • Prioritize nursing care for assigned critically ill patients, based on assessment data or identified needs.
  • Consult and coordinate with healthcare team members to assess, plan, implement, or evaluate patient care plans.
  • Perform emergency medical procedures, such as basic cardiac life support (BLS), and other condition stabilizing interventions.
  • Manage patients' pain relief and sedation by providing pharmacologic and non-pharmacologic interventions, monitoring patients' responses, and changing care plans accordingly.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Surgical Services/Operating Room (OR) Qualifications:
  • Current licensure in North Carolina as a Registered Nurse or Compact state licensure.
  • Graduate of an accredited Registered/Professional Nursing program.
  • At least 1 year RN experience required.
  • Circulator/Scrub experience required.
  • Basic Life Support (BLS), required.
  • Other certifications as required by department.

Johns Hopkins Aramco Healthcare (JHAH) is a first-of-its-kind health care joint venture between Saudi Aramco, a world leader in energy, and Johns Hopkins Medicine, a leading US academic health system.  This organization provides innovative, integrated and patient-centered care to over 350,000 Saudi Aramco employees and health care beneficiaries.

JHAH seeks an experienced Neurologist to join their four-physician department at their main hospital in Dhahran, a state-of-the-art 330-bed referral institution and an additional Neurologist at their facility in Al-Hasa.
  • The newly recruited Physician will have a general Neurology practice and, as an employee of JHAH, will receive a highly competitive base salary and exceptional benefits.
  • The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia workweek is Sunday-Thursday, 7 am-4 pm.
  • At this time, Saudi Arabia does not levy personal income taxes; therefore, your JHAH income is not taxed by Saudi Arabia. Depending on the taxation laws in your country of origin and provided you meet statutory requirements, income earned from employment in Saudi Arabia may be excluded from your home country’s taxation. If, however, you are obligated to pay income tax in your home country, JHAH will reimburse that obligation.
  • The generous benefits package includes, but is not limited to the following: housing allowance, monthly transportation allowance, travel allowance, and relocation and temporary housing allowance.
Qualifications:

  • Fluency in English is required; fluency in Arabic is helpful, but not required
  • Meets the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Health Commission Bi-Law requirements for “Consultant” status
  • Interests in Movement Disorder, Epilepsy and/or Neuroimmunology are welcome, but not required.

JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Emergency Department (ED)
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) - Good Samaritan Medical Center - Brockton, MA

***Up to $15,000 Sign On Bonus***
*Call Recruiter for details

Come join Steward Health Care System where we strive to serve the needs of our communities by delivering the highest quality of care with compassion and respect. Our continued focus on the patient experience informs our caregivers in how to provide care that is respectful of and responsive to individual patient and family preferences, needs and values.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Job Summary:

The Emergency Department RN Provides direct and indirect patient care in the emergency care setting. Provides care that reflects initiative, flexibility and responsibility indicative of professional expectation with a minimum of supervision. Is able to triage safely, rapidly and accurately, every patient that enters the emergency care system. Determines priorities of care based on physical and psychosocial needs, as well as factors influencing patient flow through the system. Communicates with Emergency Department physicians about changes in patient's status, symptomatology and results of diagnostic studies. Is able to respond quickly and accurately to changes in condition or response to treatment. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Provides direct patient care, evaluates outcomes, consults with other specialists as required and adjusts nursing care processes as indicated to ensure optimal patient care.
  • Ability to perform a head-to-toe assessment on all patients and reassessments as per policy. This includes pediatric, adolescent and geriatric patients and the general patient population.
  • Ability to adequately assess and reassess pain.
  • Utilizes appropriate pain management techniques.
  • Educates the patient and family regarding pain management.
  • Performs all aspects of patient care in an environment that optimizes patient safety and reduces the likelihood of medical/health care errors.
  • Ability to monitor hemodynamic status of patient and correctly interpret the results.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of cardiac monitoring, identifies dysrhythmias and treats appropriately.
  • Accurately assigns triage categories.
  • Identifies and addresses psychosocial, cultural, ethnic and religious/spiritual needs of patients and family.
  • Functions as liaison between administration, patients, physicians and other healthcare providers.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and the skills necessary to provide age appropriate care to the patients served.
  • Able to interpret data about the patient's status in order to identify each patient's age specific needs and provide care needed by the patient group.
 
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Qualifications:
  • Current MA license.
  • Excellent assessment skills, clinical skills and organizational skills and charge capabilities. 
  • BSN or currently enrolled in a BSN program preferred.
  • Must have at least one year of acute care experience.
  • Experience in the Emergency Room is required.

JOB.JobDescription:
Practice in a truly state-of-the-art cancer center with other outstanding physicians and surgeons.

Benign Hematology Position
Miami, Florida

The Miami Cancer Institute, a leading example of a “next generation” “hybrid” cancer center,  is seeking a Benign Hematologist to join its highly respected multidisciplinary medical team. The state-of-the-art 395,000 square foot Cancer Institute serves the Southeastern region of the United States, Latin America, and the Caribbean. We welcome both experienced and newly-trained Hematologists and Medical Oncologist to consider this outstanding opportunity.

Practice:
  • Baptist Health South Florida, one of the most financially secure health systems in the United States, opened the Miami Cancer Institute in January, 2017.
  • The physician medical staff at the Cancer Institute includes over 80 physicians and surgeons. Due to extraordinary practice growth, an increasing referral base, quality care, and patient access, the Miami Cancer Institute has a dynamic strategic growth plan in place.

  • Your practice will include a mix of hospital consults and an outpatient office-based practice. You will be supported by your own Advanced Practitioner.
  • The Institute has 68 infusion rooms and offers all  Radiation Oncology modalities, including Proton therapy (pencil beam scanning), Gamma Knife, CyberKnife, and Tomotherapy.
  • The Miami Cancer Institute enjoys a deep and functional alliance with Memorial Sloan Kettering, which emphasizes a sharing of standards of care and clinical trials.
  • The compensation package is extremely competitive and includes a high base salary and incentive package affording you an opportunity to earn in the MGMA 90th percentile. In addition, a comprehensive benefits and relocation package is offered.
Location:

  • Miami’s airport offers a vast option of domestic and international flights.
As a Hematologist, you have a number of new opportunities to consider. However, few will offer you the personal and professional satisfaction, the opportunity to work in a truly state-of-the-art facility with highly regarded colleagues, and the high financial rewards offered by this position. JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Radiology
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) Radiology - CentraState Medical Center - Freehold, NJ

CentraState Healthcare System is currently seeking a Radiology Registered Nurse (RN).

Registered Nurse (RN) Radiology Position Overview:

Administers nursing care to assigned patients that is in accordance with ANA standards, ARIN (Association for Radiologic & Imaging Nursing), the NJ Practice Act, Joint Commission and established hospital and Nursing Department policy and procedures. Provides 24 hour on-call weekend coverage on a rotating basis from Friday 5:00pm through Sunday. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Implements nursing care as indicated by patient care plan.
  • Provides nursing care for angiographic and other special procedures.
  • Consistently includes patient and family in the development of an individualized plan of care.
  • Administers medications as needed following CSHS policies and manufacturer's instructions.
  • Takes immediate and appropriate actions in the event of a medication variance occurrence.
  • Maintains and upgrades own nursing practice and development.
  • Recognizes changes in patient condition and/or emergencies situations and takes immediate and appropriate actions.
  • Participates in unit conferences to discuss quality issues and quality improvement strategies.
  • Makes decisions that demonstrate knowledge of nursing practice; utilizes sound nursing judgment in clinical and patient care management situations.
  • Demonstrates critical thinking skills in the care of patients and in the coordination of care to assure the achievement of maximum outcome.
  • Starts and monitors IVS and solutions following nursing department policies and procedures.
  • Acts as liaison between Nursing and Radiology departments.
  • Controls all medications and controlled drugs in the Radiology Department.
  • Documents results of patient assessment, nursing diagnosis, care plan and patient progress in medical record.
  • Recognizes adverse reactions to medications and takes immediate and appropriate actions.
  • Assesses and monitors patient condition while patient is in Radiology Department.

Registered Nurse (RN) Radiology Qualifications:
  • Current NJ RN license.
  • Bachelors degree preferred.

JOB.JobTitle: Permanent BMT Physician Job in Grand Rapids, Michigan
JOB.JobDescription:
Permanent BMT / CAR T-cell Therapy Position in Michigan 
Spectrum Health Medical Group

The Blood and Marrow Transplant (BMT) Program at Spectrum Health Cancer Center is the only adult BMT program in West Michigan (and just 1 of 4 in the state).  We are FACT-accredited for both Autologous and Allogeneic transplants and provide marrow, peripheral stem cell, haploidentical and umbilical cord blood transplants for cancerous and noncancerous conditions. 

Our program has performed over 600 procedures (transplants and CAR T-cell infusions).  We enjoy a state-of-the art 17,000 square foot combined outpatient provider clinic and infusion clinic and have a new 18-bed inpatient blood and marrow transplant unit in our Butterworth campus.  We seek a physician to join our multidisciplinary team:
  • Our experienced team consists of two BMT physicians, six APPs, two pharmacists, a medical social worker, and RN clinical transplant coordinators.
  • Call is shared amongst the BMT physicians in a 1:3-4 weekly rotation; APP takes first call.
  • This is a 100% BMT practice—inpatient and outpatient 
  • Academic appointment at Michigan State University available
  • Opportunity for clinical and laboratory research in a wide variety of hematological malignancies
  • BC Hematology/Oncology required; BMT experience or fellowship preferred; only candidates with CAR T-cell therapy experience will be considered.
Spectrum Health is a not-for-profit health system, based in West Michigan, offering a full continuum of care through the Spectrum Health Hospital Group, which is comprised of 12 hospitals including Helen DeVos Children’s Hospital; 180 ambulatory and service sites; 3,200 employed physicians and advanced practice providers including members of the Spectrum Health Medical Group; and Priority Health, a 790,000-member health plan. Spectrum Health is West Michigan’s largest employer with 25,300 employees. 
 
Grand Rapids, Michigan is a cosmopolitan area and the second largest city in the state located just 35 minutes from the shores of Lake Michigan and just 2 1/2 hours from Chicago! The metropolitan population of Grand Rapids is over 1 million, but Spectrum Health services a population of more than 9 million. We have strong, philanthropic communities and endless natural beauty, making Grand Rapids a great place for you and your family to call home!

JOB.JobTitle: RN MDS Coordinator
JOB.JobDescription:
RN MDS Coordinator - CentraState Healthcare System - Freehold, NJ

CentraState Healthcare System is currently Seeking an RN MDS Coordinator.

Full-Time, Days

RN MDS Coordinator Position Overview:

Initiates and assures completion of the MDS by all disciplines for all residents in accordance with CMA and the NJ DOH guidelines. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Provides considerate respectful care focused upon the residents' individual needs.
  • Affirms the resident's right to make decisions regarding his/her medical care, including the decision to discontinue treatment, to the extent permitted by law.
  • Demonstrates the ability to obtain information and interpret information in terms of the needs of the age of the residents cared for.
  • Demonstrates an understanding of the range of care needed based on the age of the residents cared for.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of growth, development and/or adult health throughout the life span as appropriate to the job performed.
  • Successfully completes life-span education as appropriate.
  • Monitors the MDS Transmission Reports to ensure accuracy.
  • Identifies, evaluates and interprets Quality Indicator reports.
  • Demonstrates critical thinking skills in the care of residents and in the coordination of are to assure the achievement of maximum outcomes.
  • Documents pain assessment, intervention and follow-up.
  • Documents reassessment of pain as per facility policy. Notifies physician for unrelieved pain as indicated.
  • Provides resident/family with education regarding pain.
  • Delegates and monitors components of care to professional and non-professional caregivers as appropriate.

JOB.JobDescription:
Johns Hopkins Aramco Healthcare (JHAH), a first-of-its-kind health care joint venture between Saudi Aramco, a world leader in energy, and Johns Hopkins Medicine, one of the world's leading academic health systems, seeks a Palliative Medicine Physician to practice at their Dhahran, Saudi Arabia hospital location.

Practice
  • The Palliative Medicine Physician (oncology focus) to join JHAH at their Dhahran, Saudi Arabia hospital location and will join six Oncologists which include Medical Oncologists, Oncologists, and Benign and Malignant Hematologists. In addition to the 6 Oncologists, there are two Pediatric Oncologists and 2 Radiation Oncologists.
  • Other oncologic consultants (separate department) include 3 GYN Oncologists, 1 Breast Surgeon, and 1 Colorectal Surgeon.
  • The physician will see patients in both an outpatient and inpatient setting at the main hospital.
  • Kingdom of Saudi Arabia workweek is Sunday-Thursday, 7 am to 4 pm and typically includes nine half-day clinic sessions per week however, the Palliative Medicine Physician will have less outpatient sessions (approximately 2 to 3 clinics per week) as the position is primarily consultative.
  • There are no call obligations at night.
  • 370-beds with a 30+ bed Oncology in-patient unit.
  • Very competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits package.
  • At this time, Saudi Arabia does not levy personal income taxes; therefore, your JHAH income is not taxed by Saudi Arabia. Depending on the taxation laws in your country of origin and provided you meet statutory requirements, income earned from employment in Saudi Arabia may be excluded from home country taxation. However, if you are obligated to pay income tax in your home country, JHAH will reimburse that obligation.
  • Relocation and temporary housing stipend.
  • Western ex-pats say "It\'s a once in a lifetime opportunity to be part of two industry giants that have combined." Nationals say "It\'s the most prestigious place to work in Saudi Arabia."
Candidate Requirements
  • Candidate must be Board Certified in Palliative Medicine.
  • Candidates must meet Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Health Commission Bi-Law requirements for "Consultant" status.
  • Certification for minimum of three years, clinical practice experience in the last two years, and the candidate must be fluent in English.
Community/Location
  • Saudi Arabia is located between Africa and Asia and is surrounded by the Arabian Gulf to the east and the Red Sea to the West.
  • Saudi Aramco Residential Camp in Dhahran, known as the Dhahran Camp, is the residential community built by Saudi Aramco for its employees. It is located within the city of Dhahran in Saudi Arabia\'s Eastern Province and near the US consulate. Dhahran Camp "has EVERYTHING" (e.g., movie theater, shops, pharmacy, quick mart, restaurants).
If you desire a "once in a lifetime" opportunity to practice and live abroad, I highly recommend you consider this opportunity and contact me.

JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Emergency Room (ER)
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) - St. Elizabeth's Medical Center - Brighton, MA

Come join Steward Health Care System where we strive to serve the needs of our communities by delivering the highest quality of care with compassion and respect. Our continued focus on the patient experience informs our caregivers in how to provide care that is respectful of and responsive to individual patient and family preferences, needs and values.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Job Summary:

The Emergency Department RN Provides direct and indirect patient care in the emergency care setting. Provides care that reflects initiative, flexibility and responsibility indicative of professional expectation with a minimum of supervision. Is able to triage safely, rapidly and accurately, every patient that enters the emergency care system. Determines priorities of care based on physical and psychosocial needs, as well as factors influencing patient flow through the system. Communicates with Emergency Department physicians about changes in patient's status, symptomatology and results of diagnostic studies. Is able to respond quickly and accurately to changes in condition or response to treatment. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Provides direct patient care, evaluates outcomes, consults with other specialists as required and adjusts nursing care processes as indicated to ensure optimal patient care.
  • Ability to perform a head-to-toe assessment on all patients and reassessments as per policy. This includes pediatric, adolescent and geriatric patients and the general patient population.
  • Ability to adequately assess and reassess pain.
  • Utilizes appropriate pain management techniques.
  • Educates the patient and family regarding pain management.
  • Performs all aspects of patient care in an environment that optimizes patient safety and reduces the likelihood of medical/health care errors.
  • Ability to monitor hemodynamic status of patient and correctly interpret the results.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of cardiac monitoring, identifies dysrhythmias and treats appropriately.
  • Accurately assigns triage categories.
  • Maintains accurate and continued nursing documentation including patient histories, conditions, treatments, responses and assessment of changes.
  • Treats patients and their families with respect and dignity.
  • Identifies and addresses psychosocial, cultural, ethnic and religious/spiritual needs of patients and family.
  • Functions as liaison between administration, patients, physicians and other healthcare providers.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and the skills necessary to provide age appropriate care to the patients served.
  • Able to interpret data about the patient's status in order to identify each patient's age specific needs and provide care needed by the patient group.
 
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Qualifications:
  • Current licensure in Massachusetts as a Registered Nurse
  • BSN required
  • ACLS. BLS, and PALS Required
  • 1-2 year ED clinical experience preferred
  • TNCC and ENPC preferred

Interested Candidates Please Contact:

Senior Healthcare Recruiter

JOB.JobTitle: Permanent Full Time Optometry Job in Tamuning, Guam
JOB.JobDescription:
The FHP Health Center located in Tamuning, Guam is seeking an Optometrist to join the FHP Vision Center. The FHP Health Center is a multi-specialty group practice with a long and successful history of providing quality care to families on Guam. FHP Vision Center is recruiting due to increasing patient volume. The FHP Vision Center provides all optical needs, frames and lenses, contact lenses, and brand-name sunglasses. The in-office, high tech surfacing lab manages most prescriptions.

Practice Information:
  • 3 Board Certified Optometrists
  • 40-hour Work Week - Clinic Hours: Monday-Saturday 8:00a.m. – 6:00p.m.
  • 6 staff members
  • 1 Supervisor
  • Daily average of 14 patients per provider
  • Five procedure rooms
  • Full time position
  • EMR CompuLink
Competitive Compensation Package:
  • 2-year salaried position
  • Annual increase every 2 years
  • 60-days free housing
  • 60-days free rental car
  • $15,000 loan repayment each year
  • 3 days CME + $3,000
  • Comprehensive benefits with TakeCare insurance coverage
  • Malpractice coverage with tail
Guam offers a tropical climate and beautiful clear waters. The climate is considered tropical marine with temperatures averaging 86F (30C) for highs and 76F(24C) for lows.

Guam is located in the Mariana Islands west of the International Dateline and within 2,000+ miles of these Asian countries – China, Philippines, South Korea, Taiwan, Japan. Since it is a United States Territory and the first American soil to welcome a new day, the slogan is “Where America’s Day Begins.” Guam has a broad selection of attractive dwellings. Gated housing communities are all around the island to fit a wide range of budgets. There are many excellent public and private schools.

JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Emergency Room (ER)
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) - Holy Family Hospital - Methuen, MA

Come join Steward Health Care System where we strive to serve the needs of our communities by delivering the highest quality of care with compassion and respect. Our continued focus on the patient experience informs our caregivers in how to provide care that is respectful of and responsive to individual patient and family preferences, needs and values.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Job Summary:

Emergency Department Registered Nurses specialize in assessing, intervening and stabilizing a variety of trauma and illnesses with decisive action. Due to the range of medical conditions that may require urgent treatment and care, they must be knowledgeable about general as well as specific health issues.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Job Description:
  • The Registered Nurse provides patient care based on standards of care, standards of practice, protocols, and established policies and procedures.
  • Collaboratively plans and prepares patient/family for discharge incorporating support systems/resources necessary.
  • Appropriately prioritizes patient care (e.g. seeks assistance as needed from appropriate resources, reassigns personnel as necessary, recognizes need for emergency intervention, etc.)
  • Provides thorough, timely and accurate documentation of all pertinent data, therapeutic interventions and patient responses including assessment, care plan, patient goals and interventions according to established standards.
  • Proactively identifies risk to patient safety and identifies opportunities to reduce medical/health care errors (i.e. appropriate reporting of errors/incidents).

Pediatric Surgery
West Islip, NY (Long Island)

Catholic Health Services of Long Island (CHSLI), named one of the country’s “Best Places to Work” by Modern Healthcare Magazine and honored by Newsday as a Top Workplace on Long Island in 2018 is a fully integrated health system comprised of six hospitals serving the communities of Long Island, is an integrated health care delivery system with six hospitals, three skilled nursing facilities, a regional home nursing service, hospice and a multiservice, community-based agency for persons with special needs. CHS has 1,928 certified hospital beds, 790 nursing home beds, approximately 18,400 employees, more than 4,300 medical staff and annual revenues which exceed $2 billion.

CHSLI is seeking a Pediatric Surgeon to serve a key role on their Pediatric Surgery team. Experience quick practice growth as you will be replacing a retiring Pediatric Surgeon. Your practice will be located at Good Samaritan Hospital Medical Center (GSHMC) in West Islip, NY. 

GSHMC is a 437-bed hospital, an American College of Surgeons (ACS) accredited Level II Pediatric Trauma Center and is home to the largest children’s medical center on the South Shore of Long Island.

Enjoy a large clinical practice:
  • Strong existing volume and referral streams – referral base of over 100 pediatricians, Pediatric sub-specialists, and Family Medicine physicians 
  • All the Pediatric Sub-specialists are located on the hospital campus
  • A four (4) bedded PICU, a sixteen (16) bedded NICU with in-house neonatologists, in-house pediatric hospitalists, seven (7) pediatric anesthesiologists, pediatric radiologists and pathologists provide support for surgical patients.  
  • The Pediatric Emergency Department receives 25,000 visits per year
  • Generous income package includes a base salary, an incentive bonus as well as a possible signing bonus and relocation
  • A comprehensive benefits package is included
  • You will be supported by an Advanced Practitioner and an experienced nursing staff
Long Island gives you an opportunity to choose from many desirable communities to live with a great selection of lovely homes, excellent schools, and an abundance of outdoor recreational amenities available including the local beaches. Many excellent restaurants, theater, galleries, and other fun activities can be found throughout this area of Long Island and is in close proximity to Manhattan.

There are very few Pediatric Surgery opportunities which will afford you the opportunity to be very busy immediately and enjoy a great deal of professional and personal satisfaction while making a substantial income in a very desirable place to live. JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Emergency Department (ED)
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) - Saint Anne's Hospital - Fall River, MA

Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Job Summary:

The RN is responsible for providing direct patient care based on the nursing process within assigned work periods. He/she functions as a member of a multidisciplinary team to achieve outcomes consistent with the comprehensive plan of care. The RN participates in activities to achieve clinical, financial and organizational outcomes. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Provides direct patient care, evaluates outcomes, consults with other specialists as required and adjusts nursing care processes as indicated to ensure optimal patient care.
  • Ability to perform a head-to-toe assessment on all patients and reassessments as per policy. This includes pediatric, adolescent and geriatric patients and the general patient population.
  • Ability to adequately assess and reassess pain.
  • Utilizes appropriate pain management techniques.
  • Educates the patient and family regarding pain management.
  • Performs all aspects of patient care in an environment that optimizes patient safety and reduces the likelihood of medical/health care errors.
  • Ability to monitor hemodynamic status of patient and correctly interpret the results.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of cardiac monitoring, identifies dysrhythmias and treats appropriately.
  • Accurately assigns triage categories.
  • Identifies and addresses psychosocial, cultural, ethnic and religious/spiritual needs of patients and family.
  • Functions as liaison between administration, patients, physicians and other healthcare providers.
  • Demonstrates knowledge of the principles of growth and development over the life span and the skills necessary to provide age appropriate care to the patients served.
  • Able to interpret data about the patient's status in order to identify each patient's age specific needs and provide care needed by the patient group.
 
Registered Nurse (RN) - Emergency Department (ED) Qualifications:
  • Associate’s degree or diploma from an accredited school of nursing.
  • BSN strongly preferred.
  • For specialty areas, related experience and qualifications may be required.
  • MA RN license and BLS.

Johns Hopkins Aramco Healthcare (JHAH) seeks an exceptional, full-time Dermatologist to join the practice at the JHAH main hospital in Dhahran, a state-of-the-art 330-bed referral institution.  Johns Hopkins Aramco Healthcare (JHAH) is a first-of-its-kind health care joint venture between Saudi Aramco, a world leader in energy, and Johns Hopkins Medicine, a leading US academic health system.  This organization provides innovative, integrated and patient-centered care to over 350,000 Saudi Aramco employees and health care beneficiaries. The newly recruited Dermatologist will be employed by JHAH and receive a highly competitive base salary.

  • The newly recruited physician will join two BC Dermatologists and a team of experienced nursing, technical and administrative support staff
  • The Department of Dermatology provides primary, secondary and tertiary adult and pediatric dermatology. 
  • Kingdom of Saudi Arabia workweek is Sunday-Thursday, 7 am-4 pm. 
  • Call will be shared in a weekly rotation of 7:00 – 4:00 pm and 24-hour weekend and holiday call
  • Dermatologists provide inpatient consults
  • Teaching and research opportunities 
  • Dermatology services are also offered at two nearby district clinics
  • This is an established high volume practice
  • EPIC EMR
Candidate Requirements
  • Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Health Commission Bi-Law requirements are Board Certification for a minimum of three years by start date
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Fluent in English - fluency in Arabic is a plus.
Practice Benefits  
  • At this time, Saudi Arabia does not levy personal income taxes; therefore, your JHAH income is not taxed by Saudi Arabia. 
  • Depending on the taxation laws in your country of origin and provided you meet statutory requirements, income earned from employment in Saudi Arabia may be excluded from home country taxation. 
  • However, if you are obligated to pay income tax in your home country, JHAH will reimburse that obligation.
  • Our generous benefits package includes, but is not limited to, family medical care, housing allowance, monthly transportation allowance, travel allowance, and relocation and temporary housing allowance
  • Kingdom of Saudi Arabia Health Commission Bi-Law requirements for “Consultant” status:  Board Certification for minimum of three years by start date.
  • Candidate must be fluent in English and fluency in Arabic is a plus

JOB.JobTitle: Surgical Technologist
JOB.JobDescription:
Surgical Technologist - St. Elizabeth's Medical Center - Brighton, MA

Come join Steward Health Care System where we strive to serve the needs of our communities by delivering the highest quality of care with compassion and respect. Our continued focus on the patient experience informs our caregivers in how to provide care that is respectful of and responsive to individual patient and family preferences, needs and values.

Surgical Technologist Job Summary:

The Surgical Technician (OR Tech) is an essential member of the Surgical Team; a trained professional who possesses extraordinary technical skills as it relates to supporting all surgical specialties. The role of the OR Tech encompasses technical skills of scrubbing, assisting the Perioperative Team with activities within the operating room, clinical knowledge of a variety of Surgical procedures, clinical teaching skills, continuous quality improvement and a variety of OR-related duties (including pre, intra and post). Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Expertly performs role of a resource surgical technician in all surgical specialties.
  • Performs scrub duties according to procedure, demonstrating a high level of skill and efficiency, while displaying the surgical consciousness required within this highly specialized environment.
  • Works closely with all Perioperative team to facilitate and coordinate exceptional, efficient, and quality patient care.
  • Contributes to the team by participating in staff meetings and in-service presentations.
  • Accountable for accurate counts of sponges, needles and instruments as appropriate before, during and after surgical procedures.
  • Demonstrates a working knowledge of national patient safety goals.
  • Acts as preceptor for staff members for all aspects of the Perioperative.
  • Demonstrates collegial behavior of respect and consideration with regard to work environment (i.e. restocking rooms, returning equipment/supplies for other surgical procedures, cleaning work areas/station and or communication as appropriate).
  • Has a surgical conscience in the principles of aseptic technique in maintaining a sterile environment.
  • Anticipates the instruments/equipment the surgeon will need next.
  • Assists in turnover of rooms and preps OR for patients.
  • Is an active participant in the "Time Out" giving one’s full attention to the process and will speak up if something does not seem right, stopping the line until there is resolution.
  • Team player who can complete tasks with a high degree of accuracy in a fast-paced environment.
  • Hold retractors and complete additional tasks at surgeon’s request during procedure.
  • Handles tissue specimens obtained for laboratory analysis.
  • Organize and restock the OR following surgical procedures.

Surgical Technologist Qualifications:
  • High School graduate and/or GED.
  • Accredited Surgical Tech Program Required.
  • Associates Degree preferred.
  • Minimum 1 year Surgical Tech experience in a hospital setting required.
  • National Certification as a Surgical Tech required.

JOB.JobTitle: Surgical Technologist
JOB.JobDescription:
Surgical Technologist - Nashoba Valley Medical Center - Ayer, MA

Come join Steward Health Care System where we strive to serve the needs of our communities by delivering the highest quality of care with compassion and respect. Our continued focus on the patient experience informs our caregivers in how to provide care that is respectful of and responsive to individual patient and family preferences, needs and values.

Surgical Technologist Job Summary:

The Surgical Technologist assists the surgeon during invasive and non-invasive procedures. Ensures operating suite is adequately prepared for procedure and safe for patient care. Works with team members to monitor and maintain PAR levels of all surgical instruments and supplies. Assists with room turnover and the cleaning and sterilization of all surgical instruments. Participates in departmental staff meetings and performance improvement activities.

Surgical Technologist Job Description:
  • Makes decisions reflecting knowledge of facts and good judgment within the Operating Room Technician’s scope of practice.
  • Checks all equipment/instruments needed, prior to each procedure to ensure proper functioning.
  • Prepares room in a timely manner with all anticipated instruments, sutures, supplies and equipment for each individual surgical procedure.
  • The Surgical Tech sets up, scrubs and prepares for procedures at least 15 minutes prior to scheduled time, unless otherwise directed by Circulating RN or Nurse Manager.
  • Follows aseptic technique, when opening sterile supplies and setting up procedures.
  • Performs all aspects of patient care in an environment that optimizes patient safety and reduces the likelihood of medical/health care errors.
  • Adapts procedures to meet individual needs of neonate, pediatric, adolescent, adult and geriatric patients for treatment.
  • Performs services requiring technical or manual skills under the direction of Circulating RN.
  • Carries out medical/surgical asepsis during treatments/procedures.
  • Accurately completes operating room counts (instruments, sponges, needles); follows proper procedure in the event of incorrect count; reports all discrepancies to Circulating RN and surgeon and/or corrects immediately.
  • Assists in patient transfer, positioning, prepping and draping of patients for surgical procedures.
  • Demonstrates competence in care of specimens and accurately handles specimens at all times.
  • Anticipates needs of surgeon during intraoperative phase.
  • Cleans and prepares rooms between procedures and after last case; restocks supplies, when necessary and organizes effectively for end-of-case clean up.

Surgical Technologist Qualifications:
  • High School diploma or equivalent.
  • Completion of an Accredited Surgical Technologist Program.
  • BCLS certification required.
  • Minimum of one (1) year work experience in the Operating Room.
  • Surgical Technologist Certification required.

JOB.JobTitle: Registered Nurse (RN) Intensive Care Unit (ICU)
JOB.JobDescription:
Registered Nurse (RN) Intensive Care Unit (ICU) - Carney Hospital - Dorchester, MA

Registered Nurse (RN) - Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Job Summary:
  • Intensive Care Unit Registered Nurses are responsible for carrying out nursing accountabilities within the ICU. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Evaluate patients' vital signs or laboratory data to determine emergency intervention needs.
  • Monitor patients for changes in status and indications of conditions such as sepsis or shock and institute appropriate interventions.
  • Set up and monitor medical equipment and devices such as cardiac monitors, mechanical ventilators and alarms, oxygen delivery devices, transducers, or pressure lines.
  • Administer medications intravenously, by injection, orally, through gastric tubes, or by other methods.
  • Assess patients' pain levels or sedation requirements.
  • Conduct pulmonary assessments to identify abnormal respiratory patterns or breathing sounds that indicate problems.
  • Monitor patients' fluid intake and output to detect emerging problems, such as fluid and electrolyte imbalances.
  • Document patients' medical histories and assessment findings.
  • Prioritize nursing care for assigned critically ill patients, based on assessment data or identified needs.
  • Assist physicians with procedures such as bronchoscopy, endoscopy, endotracheal intubation, or elective cardioversion.
  • Collaborate with other health care professionals to develop and revise treatment plans, based on identified needs and assessment data.
  • Document patients' treatment plans, interventions, outcomes, or plan revisions.

Registered Nurse (RN) - Intensive Care Unit (ICU) Qualifications:
  • Graduate of an accredited school of nursing, BSN preferred.
  • Current MA Registered Nurse Licensure.
  • Two or more years of recent critical care experience preferred.
  • Successful completion of critical care course.
  • Current ACLS and BCLS certification.

JOB.JobTitle: Oncology Pharmacy Supervisor
JOB.JobDescription:
Are you a highly organized worker with the ability to take on a leadership role? Do you have excellent communication skills and attention to detail? If so, this Pharmacy Supervisor of Oncology position is for you! For more information, submit your resume to apply today.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversees assigned exempt and nonexempt pharmacy staff, providing direction and support.
  • Upholds current department licenses, registrations, and Power of Attorney for DEA Order Forms, including revocations. Observes registered pharmacist and technician compliance with state-mandated continuing educational requirements.
  • Interviews, selects and onboards new employees.
  • Plans and manages staff schedules.
  • Reviews personnel actions of subordinates in addressing complaints and resolving problems.
  • Supervises the inventory control system to ensure the department remains adequately stocked and is responsive to dramatic fluctuation in the use of pharmaceutical items.
  • Monitors the safe and accurate dispensing of all prescriptions and over the counter drugs (OTCs)
  • Conducts pharmacy orientation programs for new site clinicians, including Formulary pharmacy benefit, local initiatives, etc. Provides in-service programs to clinical areas, as needed.
  • Directly provides for the appropriate storage and accountability of all drugs within the site and oversees acquisition and disbursement.
  • Under the supervision of the Chief Pharmacist, prepares regular administrative reports.
  • Handles routine patient complaints that cannot be resolved immediately or are interdepartmental in nature (waiting time, inappropriate staff situations, and lost prescriptions).
  • Performs duties of the chief pharmacist, in the absence of the chief pharmacist.

Requirements:

  • Graduate of accredited school of Pharmacy and currently licensed in Massachusetts as a registered pharmacist
  • 3 years’ experience as a pharmacist in an oncology/infusion pharmacy with a progressively more responsible leadership position
To learn more about this exciting opportunity, please apply directly to this post, send your resume to mtucker@crosscountry.com!

Primary Care Practice/Rehabilitation Medicine
Center City Philadelphia, Pennsylvania

Philadelphia’s premier physician owned Medical Office and Rehabilitation Center seeks a Primary Care Physician or Specialist to join their well-established and growing Center City, Philadelphia practice.

  • Philadelphia offers outstanding restaurants, the Arts, professional sports team, more historic sites than you can count, and so much more

JOB.JobTitle: Hematology/Oncology Staff Position - GI - New York
JOB.JobDescription:
Hematology/Oncology Staff Position
Beautiful Hudson Valley Region, NY

Health Quest, a dynamic and financially successful 250+ provider physician-run health system medical practice group within a market dominant 4 hospital system, seeks a Hematologist/Oncologist to join its expanding Oncology Service. Candidates with a strong sub-specialty interest are welcome to respond.

Practice:
  • You will play an important role in the growth and direction of this exceptional Hematology/Oncology Program. Practice general Medical Oncology and if desired, focus on your sub-specialty interest
  • With the addition of a number of Residency Programs starting in 2019 and a new Medical School in 2022 (Marist Health Quest Medical School), you will be a faculty member teaching Internal Medicine Residents and provide supervision to Advanced Practitioners and Medical Students
  • You will be part of an exceptional multi-disciplinary team made up of Medical, Surgical, and Radiation Oncologists, Pathologists, Advanced Practitioners, nurses, therapists, and patient navigators
  • The program is supported by a large referral base of physicians
  • The new state-of-the-art digital hospital will open in the Spring of 2020
  • An outstanding base salary and a production bonus will provide you with an income which compares extremely favorably with opportunities throughout the Northeast
  • A comprehensive benefits package is also included along with a potential signing bonus
Community:
  • The City of Poughkeepsie, NY is ideally located half way between New York City and Albany.
  • It serves as the county seat for Dutchess County, NY and is known as “The Queen City of the Hudson”The ratification of New York took place in Poughkeepsie when the city served as the State Capital of New York in 1788.
  • The Culinary Institute of America is located in the historic nearby town of Hyde Park. A number of graduates stayed in the Poughkeepsie area and have opened up wonderful restaurants.
  • The area is known for a number of art and entertainment institutions including the Bardovan 1869 Opera House which is home to the Hudson Valley Philharmonic.
  • There are a number of communities around the area that offer beautiful affordable homes and excellent schools. The area is home to many excellent colleges and universities.
  • Should you desire to visit New York City, it is 90 minutes away by car or train while Boston is just a three-and-a-half-hour drive.
If it is your goal to find a position that will allow you to enjoy a great deal of professional and personal satisfaction, serve a significant role in the program’s success, and receive excellent financial rewards, I highly recommend you contact me for more information.

Interested candidates please contact:

Ken Sammut

(CHSLI), named one of the country’s “Best Places to Work” by Modern Healthcare Magazine and honored by Newsday as a Top Workplace on Long Island in 2018 is a fully integrated health system comprised of six hospitals serving the communities of Long Island, is an integrated health care delivery system with six hospitals, three skilled nursing facilities, a regional home nursing service, hospice and a multi-service, community-based agency for persons with special needs. Cross Country Search has partnered with a growing, accredited American Heart Association Cardiovascular Center of Excellence, one of Becker\'s "100 Great Hospitals in America", to assist them in their search for Electrophysiology (EP) Lab - Cardiovascular Technologists (CVTs). This U.S. News "Top Performer" is located on the white, sandy beaches off the Gulf Coast in Florida. 


What\'s in it for You?
  • Three 12 hour shifts/week
  • No weekends
  • No Holidays
  • No On Call
  • 3 Dedicated Electrophysiology (EP) Labs
  • Relocation Assistance
  • Specialized Expertise in Heart and Vascular Services
  • Robust Benefits Package
  • Incentive Pay for Skill Level
Job Requirements/Responsibilities 
  • Associate\'s Degree or higher in Radiology, Cardiovascular Technology, Nursing, or Respiratory Therapy AND two (2) years experience working in a Cardiac Cath and/or Electrophysiology (EP) Lab
  • RCES, RCIS, or other Electrophysiology (EP) specific certification required
  • Current ACLS and BLS required
  • Sets up and operates specialized equipment including a physiological data recording system, programmable stimulators, mapping system, and various generators for ablation procedures.
  • Assisting the physician in the performance of all Electrophysiology (EP) Lab procedures (including device implants) by: scrubbing, circulating, and monitoring; operating Electrophysiology (EP) recording systems, stimulators, mapping systems, and all forms of ablation.

To learn more about this exciting opportunity, please send resume directly to Mercedes Tucker at mtucker@crosscountry.com!


STR-IND

JOB.JobTitle: Chief GYN Oncology Position - Long Island, NY
JOB.JobDescription:
Chief of GYN Oncology
Catholic Health Service of Long Island
An unusually attractive opportunity

Catholic Health Services of Long Island  (CHSLI) is seeking a Gynecologic Oncologist to lead and continue to develop the GYN Oncology service, and assure integration with the other CHSLI clinical services. The system also has an opening for a staff Gyn Oncologist. 

(CHSLI), named one of the country’s “Best Places to Work” by Modern Healthcare Magazine and honored by Newsday as a Top Workplace on Long Island in 2018 is a fully integrated health system comprised of six hospitals serving the communities of Long Island, is an integrated health care delivery system with six hospitals, three skilled nursing facilities, a regional home nursing service, hospice and a multi-service, community-based agency for persons with special needs. CHSLI has 1,928 certified hospital beds, 790 nursing home beds, approximately 18,400 employees, more than 4,300 medical staff and annual revenues which exceed $2 billion.

The CHSLI medical group includes over 600 physicians and 2500 support staff. The physicians and surgeons work in our six hospitals and 70 ambulatory offices. 

Enjoy a large clinical practice:

  • Strong existing volume and referral streams with a yearly Gyn Oncology surgical case load of over 450 cases
  • Very large referral base of Medical Oncologists and Obstetricians help support the practice
  • Play a key role in CHSLI's’ Gynecologic Oncology Fellowship, Minimally Invasive Gynecologic Fellowship, and Ob/Gyn Residency Program
  • The financial package is extremely generous
  • The income package includes a base salary, leadership stipend, incentive bonus, and on-call pay as well as a signing bonus and relocation
  • A comprehensive benefits package is included generous and competitive when compared to the Northeast and the rest of country    
  • You will be supported by an Advanced Practitioner and an experienced nursing staff

   
Long Island gives you an opportunity to choose from many desirable communities to live with a great selection of lovely homes, excellent schools, and an abundance of outdoor recreational amenities available including the local beaches. Many excellent restaurants, theater, galleries, and other fun activities can be found throughout this area of Long Island and is in close proximity to Manhattan.

There are very few Women’s Health/GYN Oncology opportunities which will afford you the opportunity to lead an established service, play a key role in teaching, and enjoy a great deal of professional and personal satisfaction while making a substantial income in a very desirable place to live.
